title: Rewterz Threat Advisory CVE-2022-29266 Apache APISIX Vulnerability

titles: Rewterz Threat Advisory CVE-2022-29266 Apache APISIX Vulnerability

sentences: Upgrade to the latest version of Apache APISIX, available from the Apache Web site.
titles: Rewterz Threat Advisory CVE-2022-29266 Apache APISIX Vulnerability

sentences: Apache could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error logic in the dependency library lua-resty-jwt that leak secrets in error response. By sending a specially-crafted JSON Web Token to a route protected by the jwt-auth plugin, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the plugin-configured secret information, and use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.

Apache could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error logic in the dependency library lua-resty-jwt that leak secrets in error response. By sending a specially-crafted JSON Web Token to a route protected by the jwt-auth plugin, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the plugin-configured secret information, and use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.
